abstract: A class that represents a graphics device in a VM.
overview:
## Overview

You don’t instantiate a `VZGraphicsDevice` directly. Graphics devices are first configured on the [doc://com.apple.virtualization/documentation/Virtualization/VZVirtualMachineConfiguration] through a subclass of [doc://com.apple.virtualization/documentation/Virtualization/VZGraphicsDeviceConfiguration].

When the framework creates a [doc://com.apple.virtualization/documentation/Virtualization/VZVirtualMachine] from the configuration, the graphics devices are available through the [doc://com.apple.virtualization/documentation/Virtualization/VZVirtualMachine/graphicsDevices] property.

The real type of [doc://com.apple.virtualization/documentation/Virtualization/VZGraphicsDevice] corresponds to the type used by the configuration.

For example, a [doc://com.apple.virtualization/documentation/Virtualization/VZVirtioGraphicsDeviceConfiguration] leads to a device of type [doc://com.apple.virtualization/documentation/Virtualization/VZVirtioGraphicsDevice] and a [doc://com.apple.virtualization/documentation/Virtualization/VZMacGraphicsDeviceConfiguration] leads to a device of type [doc://com.apple.virtualization/documentation/Virtualization/VZMacGraphicsDevice].

# VZGraphicsDevice

**Class**

A class that represents a graphics device in a VM.

## Declaration

```swift
class VZGraphicsDevice
```

## Overview

You don’t instantiate a `VZGraphicsDevice` directly. Graphics devices are first configured on the [doc://com.apple.virtualization/documentation/Virtualization/VZVirtualMachineConfiguration] through a subclass of [doc://com.apple.virtualization/documentation/Virtualization/VZGraphicsDeviceConfiguration].

When the framework creates a [doc://com.apple.virtualization/documentation/Virtualization/VZVirtualMachine] from the configuration, the graphics devices are available through the [doc://com.apple.virtualization/documentation/Virtualization/VZVirtualMachine/graphicsDevices] property.

The real type of [doc://com.apple.virtualization/documentation/Virtualization/VZGraphicsDevice] corresponds to the type used by the configuration.

For example, a [doc://com.apple.virtualization/documentation/Virtualization/VZVirtioGraphicsDeviceConfiguration] leads to a device of type [doc://com.apple.virtualization/documentation/Virtualization/VZVirtioGraphicsDevice] and a [doc://com.apple.virtualization/documentation/Virtualization/VZMacGraphicsDeviceConfiguration] leads to a device of type [doc://com.apple.virtualization/documentation/Virtualization/VZMacGraphicsDevice].

## Getting the device’s displays

- **displays**: The list of graphics displays configured for this graphics device.

## Related Documentation

- **VZGraphicsDeviceConfiguration**: The base class for a graphics device configuration.
- **VZMacGraphicsDeviceConfiguration**: Configuration for a display attached to a Mac graphics device.

## Devices

- **VZGraphicsDisplay**: A class that represents a graphics display in a VM.
- **VZMacGraphicsDevice**: An object that represents a Mac graphics device.
- **VZVirtioGraphicsScanout**: A Virtio graphics scanout that corresponds to a Virtio graphics scanout configuration.
- **VZMacGraphicsDisplay**: An object that represents the graphics display on a Mac.
- **VZVirtioGraphicsDevice**: A Virtio graphics device.

## Inherits From

- NSObject

## Inherited By

- VZMacGraphicsDevice
- VZVirtioGraphicsDevice

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSObjectProtocol
